definition: to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

sentences.english: The parachutists dived from the plane.
Free-flying aesthetes in the skies of Russia conclude the World Artistic Skydiving Championships.
sentences.chinese: 自由飛行審美家欣賞在俄羅斯舉行的世界跳傘錦標賽。

sentences.english: From the point of view of parachuting, the wing is actually a branch of parachuting.
sentences.chinese: 從跳傘角度來講，其實翼裝是跳傘運動的一個分支。

sentences.english: From the point of view of parachuting, the wing is actually a branch of parachuting.
sentences.chinese: 從跳傘角度來講，其實翼裝是跳傘運動的一個分支。

sentences.english: Bail out of an airplane at an elevation of 2000 feet.
sentences.chinese: 在二千英尺高度從飛機中跳傘。

sentences.english: The enemy aircraft plunged down in flames before the pilot had time to bail out.
sentences.chinese: 敵飛行員還沒來得及跳傘，飛機就冒着火栽下來了。

sentences.english: He did this with a group that performed flying tricks to earn money.
sentences.chinese: 他和一羣人一起表演飛行跳傘，以此來掙錢。

sentences.english: BASE jumpers take a flight off an 876-foot-high bridge over the New River Gorge.
sentences.chinese: 低空跳傘者從876英尺高的新河峽大橋跳下。
凌晨4點鐘，傘兵們開始跳傘。

sentences.english: Even without the gorgeous backdrop, skydiving is surreal.
sentences.chinese: 甚至除去那華麗的背景，跳傘都是超現實主義的。

sentences.english: Some divers couldn't get more than a word or two typed out, but others were slightly more successful.
sentences.chinese: 一些跳傘者連一或兩個單詞都打不出來。

sentences.english: Soldiers of the landing and assault battalion jump with parachutes approximately 5 times in a year.
sentences.chinese: 登陸和突襲營的士兵每年要進行大概五次跳傘訓練。

sentences.english: My mum thinks that skydiving is crazy.
sentences.chinese: 我媽認爲跳傘運動很愚蠢。

sentences.english: Question: Imagine you have to either bungee jump or skydive. Which would you choose?
sentences.chinese: 如果要玩蹦極跳或者跳傘。你會選哪個？

sentences.english: The parachutists dived from the plane.

definition: to explore/to go on an expedition/adventure
to travel around (the world, a country etc)
to go on a journey/to leave
